notes: The default file format is 'jpeg'.
The default file format is 'jpeg'.
If the url has the 'ms-browser-extension://' protocol it is mistakenly considered a relative URL and the prefix is added redundantly, causing tab to fail loading.
Before version 57, extensions were not allowed to open 'view-source:' pages.
Before version 57, extensions were not allowed to open 'view-source:' pages.
Only accepts a single tab ID as a parameter, not an array.
The tab ID argument is optional: if it is omitted, the browser discards the least important tab.
The callback is passed a Tab object representing the tab that was discarded.
Tabs whose document contains a beforeunload listener that displays a prompt will be discarded.
Only accepts a single tab ID as a parameter, not an array.
The tab ID argument is optional: if it is omitted, the browser discards the least important tab.
The callback is passed a Tab object representing the tab that was discarded.
Tabs whose document contains a beforeunload listener that displays a prompt will be discarded.
Extensions can't inject scripts into their own pages using this API.
Before version 50, Firefox would pass a single result value into its callback rather than an array, unless 'allFrames' had been set.
Extensions can't inject scripts into their own pages using this API.
'allFrames' and 'frameId' can't both be set at the same time.
'allFrames' and 'frameId' can't both be set at the same time.
'allFrames' and 'frameId' can't both be set at the same time.
The panel, app, devtools and popup values for WindowType are not supported.
Treated as an alias for queryInfo.active.
Treated as an alias for queryInfo.active.

Treated as an alias for queryInfo.active except when an extension has a popup open. In this situation, queryInfo.highlighted will return the popup, while queryInfo.active will return the tab that was selected before the popup opened.
Treated as an alias for queryInfo.active.
Fails if the extension doesn't have the tabs permission.
Before Firefox 56, moz-extension:// URLs were not allowed.

This function does not work on macOS.
No response is sent after the receiving tab is refreshed if there is no `runtime.onMessage` listener.
